expected: The processing of personal data by an authorised entity carried out by an authorised entity within the framework of this Regulation shall be carried out by an authorised entity in compliance with Directives 95/46/EC and 2002/58/EC.
actual: The processing of personal data by an authorised entity carried out within the framework of this Regulation by an authorised entity shall be carried out by an authorised entity in compliance with Directives 95/46/EC and 2002/58/EC.

expected: A registered domain name shall be unavailable for further registration until the registration has expired without renewal, or until the domain name has been revoked by the Registry.
actual: A registered domain name shall be unavailable for further registration until the registration has expired without renewal, or until the domain name has been revoked by the Registry.

expected: A domain name may also be revoked by the Registry, and where necessary subsequently transferred by the Registry to another party, following an appropriate ADR or judicial procedure, in accordance with the principles and procedures on the functioning of the .eu TLD laid down pursuant to Article 11, where that name is identical or confusingly similar to a name in respect of which a right is established by Union or national law, and where it has been registered by its holder without rights or legitimate interest in the name;
actual: A domain name may also be revoked by the Registry, and where necessary subsequently transferred to another party by the Registry, following an appropriate ADR or judicial procedure, in accordance with the principles and procedures on the functioning of the .eu TLD laid down pursuant to Article 11, where that name is identical or confusingly similar to a name in respect of which a right is established by Union or national law, and where it has been registered by its holder without rights or legitimate interest in the name;

expected: A domain name may also be revoked by the Registry, and where necessary subsequently transferred by the Registry to another party, following an appropriate ADR or judicial procedure, in accordance with the principles and procedures on the functioning of the .eu TLD laid down pursuant to Article 11, where that name is identical or confusingly similar to a name in respect of which a right is established by Union or national law, and where it has been registered or is being used in bad faith.
actual: A domain name may also be revoked by the Registry, and where necessary subsequently transferred to another party by the Registry, following an appropriate ADR or judicial procedure, in accordance with the principles and procedures on the functioning of the .eu TLD laid down pursuant to Article 11, where that name is identical or confusingly similar to a name in respect of which a right is established by Union or national law, and where it has been registered or is being used in bad faith.

expected: Domain names registered by the Registry under the .eu TLD shall be transferable by Registrars only to parties eligible for registration of .eu TLD names.
actual: Domain names registered under the .eu TLD by the Registry shall be transferable by the registrars only to parties eligible for registration of .eu TLD names.

expected: The registration of domain names shall be carried out by the Registry in all the characters of the official languages of the Union institutions, in accordance with the available international standards as allowed by the relevant Internationalised Domain Name protocols.
actual: The registration of domain names shall be carried out by the Registry in all the characters of the official languages of the Union institutions, in accordance with the available international standards as allowed by the relevant Internationalised Domain Name protocols.

expected: With respect to point (b) of the first subparagraph, such domain names shall be limited by the Registry to broadly recognised geographical or geopolitical terms which affect the Member States' political or territorial organisation.
actual: With respect to point (b) of the first subparagraph, such domain names shall be limited by the Registry to broadly recognised geographical or geopolitical terms which affect the Member States' political or territorial organisation.

expected: Those implementing acts shall be adopted by the Commission in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 17(2).
actual: Those implementing acts shall be adopted by the Commission in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 17(2).

expected: Those representatives shall be drawn by the Commission from the private sector, the technical community, civil society and academia, as well as Member States' authorities and international organisations.
actual: Those representatives shall be drawn by the Commission from the private sector, the technical community, civil society and academia, as well as Member States' authorities and international organisations.

expected: The power to adopt delegated acts is conferred by the European Parliament on the Commission subject to the conditions laid down in this Article.
actual: The power to adopt delegated acts is conferred on the Commission by the European Parliament subject to the conditions laid down in this Article.

expected: The power to adopt delegated acts referred to in Article 8(1) shall be conferred by the European Parliament on the Commission for a period of five years from 18 April 2019.
actual: The power to adopt delegated acts referred to in Article 8(1) shall be conferred by the European Parliament on the Commission for a period of five years from 18 April 2019.

expected: The delegation of power shall be tacitly extended by the Commission for periods of an identical duration, unless the European Parliament or the Council opposes such extension not later than three months before the end of each period.
actual: The delegation of power shall be tacitly extended for periods of an identical duration by the Commission, unless the European Parliament or the Council opposes such extension not later than three months before the end of each period.

expected: A decision to revoke by the European Parliament shall put an end to the delegation of the power specified in that decision.
actual: A decision by the European Parliament to revoke shall put an end to the delegation of the power specified in that decision.

expected: The Programme shall be implemented by the Commission under direct management in accordance with the Financial Regulation.
actual: The Programme shall be implemented under direct management in accordance with the Financial Regulation by the Commission.

expected: Member States shall bear the costs related to the responsibilities conferred on them by the Commission pursuant to Article 11(3).
actual: Member States shall bear the costs related to the responsibilities conferred on them by the Commission pursuant to Article 11(3).

expected: External experts shall be selected by the Commission on the basis of their skills, experience and knowledge relevant to the specific action and according to needs.
actual: External experts shall be selected by the Commission on the basis of their skills, experience and knowledge relevant to the specific action and according to needs.

expected: Grants under the Programme shall be awarded by the Commission and managed by the Commission in accordance with Title VIII of the Financial Regulation.
actual: Grants under the Programme shall be awarded by the Commission and managed in accordance with Title VIII of the Financial Regulation by the Commission.

expected: The support from the different Union programmes may be calculated by the Commission on a pro-rata basis in accordance with the documents setting out the conditions for support.
actual: The support from the different Union programmes may be calculated by the Commission on a pro-rata basis in accordance with the documents setting out the conditions for support.

expected: In accordance with point (f) of the first paragraph of Article 195 of the Financial Regulation, grants shall be awarded by the Commission without a call for proposals where the eligible entities are customs authorities of participating countries, provided that the conditions set out in Article 5 of this Regulation are met.
actual: In accordance with point (f) of the first paragraph of Article 195 of the Financial Regulation, grants shall be awarded without a call for proposals by the Commission where the eligible entities are customs authorities of participating countries, provided that the conditions set out in Article 5 of this Regulation are met.

expected: The applicable co-financing rate where actions require the awarding of grants shall be set out by the Commission in the multiannual work programmes referred to in Article 12.
actual: The applicable co-financing rate where actions require the awarding of grants shall be set out by the Commission in the multiannual work programmes referred to in Article 12.

expected: The Programme shall be implemented by the Member States through multiannual work programmes as referred to in Article 110(2) of the Financial Regulation.
actual: The Programme shall be implemented through multiannual work programmes by the Member States as referred to in Article 110(2) of the Financial Regulation.

expected: Those implementing acts shall be adopted by the Member States in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 17(2).
actual: Those implementing acts shall be adopted by the Member States in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 17(2).

expected: The performance reporting system shall ensure that data for monitoring the implementation and the results of the Programme are collected by the Commission efficiently, effectively and in a timely manner.
actual: The performance reporting system shall ensure that data for monitoring the implementation and the results of the Programme are collected efficiently, effectively and in a timely manner by the Commission.

expected: To that end, proportionate reporting requirements shall be imposed by the Commission on the recipients of Union funds.
actual: To that end, proportionate reporting requirements shall be imposed on the recipients of Union funds by the Commission.

expected: Evaluations shall be carried out by the Commission in a timely manner so that they can be used by the Commission in the decision-making process.
actual: Evaluations shall be carried out in a timely manner by the Commission so that they can be used in the decision-making process by the Commission.

expected: Personal data shall be processed by the processor lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject (‘lawfulness, fairness and transparency’).
actual: Personal data shall be processed by the processor lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject (‘lawfulness, fairness and transparency’).

expected: Personal data shall be collected by the processor for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed by the controller in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes.
actual: Personal data shall be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes by the processor and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes by the processor.

expected: further processing by the processor for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1), not be considered by the controller to be incompatible with the initial purposes (‘purpose limitation’).
actual: further processing by the processor for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1), not be considered by the controller to be incompatible with the initial purposes (‘purpose limitation’).

expected: Personal data shall be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed by the processor (‘data minimisation’).
actual: Personal data shall be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed by the processor (‘data minimisation’).

expected: Personal data shall be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date by the processor.
actual: Personal data shall be accurate and, where necessary, kept by the processor up to date.

expected: every reasonable step must be taken by the processor to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed by the processor, are erased by the processor or rectified by the processor without delay (‘accuracy’).
actual: every reasonable step must be taken by the processor to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed by the processor, are erased by the processor or rectified without delay by the processor (‘accuracy’).

expected: Personal data shall be kept by the processor in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed.
actual: Personal data shall be kept by the processor in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed.

expected: personal data may be stored by the processor for longer periods insofar as the personal data will be processed by the processor solely for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) subject to implementation of the appropriate technical and organisational measures required by this Regulation in order to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject (‘storage limitation’).
actual: personal data may be stored for longer periods by the processor insofar as the personal data will be processed by the processor solely for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) subject to implementation of the appropriate technical and organisational measures required by this Regulation in order to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject (‘storage limitation’).

expected: Personal data shall be processed by the processor in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures (‘integrity and confidentiality’).
actual: Personal data shall be processed by the processor in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures (‘integrity and confidentiality’).

expected: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that the data subject has given consent to the processing of his or her personal data by the processor for one or more specific purposes.
actual: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that the data subject has given consent to the processing by the processor of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes.

expected: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract.
actual: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract.

expected: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject.
actual: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject.

expected: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary in order to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person.
actual: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary in order to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person.

expected: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.
actual: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.

expected: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child.
actual: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child.

expected: The purpose of the processing by the processor shall be determined by the controller in that legal basis or, as regards the processing referred to in point (e) of paragraph 1, shall be necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.
actual: The purpose of the processing by the processor shall be determined in that legal basis by the controller or, as regards the processing referred to in point (e) of paragraph 1, shall be necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.

expected: If the data subject's consent is given by the data subject in the context of a written declaration which also concerns other matters, the request for consent shall be presented by the controller in a manner which is clearly distinguishable from the other matters, in an intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.
actual: If the data subject's consent is given by the data subject in the context of a written declaration which also concerns other matters, the request for consent shall be presented by the controller in a manner which is clearly distinguishable from the other matters, in an intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.

expected: The withdrawal of consent by the data subject shall not affect the lawfulness of processing by the processor based on consent before its withdrawal.
actual: The withdrawal of consent by the data subject shall not affect the lawfulness of processing by the processor based on consent before its withdrawal.

expected: Prior to giving consent, the data subject shall be informed thereof by the controller.
actual: Prior to giving consent, the data subject shall be informed thereof by the controller.

expected: It shall be as easy for the data subject to withdraw as to give consent.
actual: It shall be as easy to withdraw by the data subject as to give consent.

expected: When assessing whether consent is freely given by the data subject, utmost account shall be taken of whether, inter alia, the performance of a contract, including the provision of a service, is conditional on consent to the processing of personal data that is not necessary for the performance of that contract.
actual: When assessing whether consent is freely given by the data subject, utmost account shall be taken of whether, inter alia, the performance of a contract, including the provision of a service, is conditional on consent to the processing of personal data that is not necessary for the performance of that contract.

expected: Where point (a) of Article 6(1) applies, in relation to the offer of information society services directly to a child, the processing by the processor of the personal data of a child shall be lawful where the child is at least 16 years old.
actual: Where point (a) of Article 6(1) applies, in relation to the offer of information society services directly to a child, the processing of the personal data of a child by the processor shall be lawful where the child is at least 16 years old.

expected: Where the child is below the age of 16 years, such processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that consent is given or authorised by the holder of parental responsibility over the child.
actual: Where the child is below the age of 16 years, such processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that consent is given or authorised by the holder of parental responsibility over the child.

expected: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for the purposes of carrying out the obligations and exercising specific rights of the controller or of the data subject in the field of employment and social security and social protection law in so far as it is authorised by Union or Member State law or a collective agreement pursuant to Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.
actual: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for the purposes of carrying out the obligations and exercising specific rights of the controller or of the data subject in the field of employment and social security and social protection law in so far as it is authorised by Union or Member State law or a collective agreement pursuant to Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.

expected: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person where the data subject is physically or legally incapable of giving consent.
actual: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person where the data subject is physically or legally incapable of giving consent.

expected: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is carried out by the processor in the course of its legitimate activities with appropriate safeguards by a foundation, association or any other not-for-profit body with a political, philosophical, religious or trade union aim and on condition that the processing relates solely to the members or to former members of the body or to persons who have regular contact with it in connection with its purposes and that the personal data are not disclosed outside that body without the consent of the data subjects.
actual: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is carried out by the processor in the course of its legitimate activities with appropriate safeguards by a foundation, association or any other not-for-profit body with a political, philosophical, religious or trade union aim and on condition that the processing relates solely to the members or to former members of the body or to persons who have regular contact with it in connection with its purposes and that the personal data are not disclosed outside that body without the consent of the data subjects.

expected: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor relates to personal data which are manifestly made public by the data subject.
actual: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor relates to personal data which are manifestly made public by the data subject.

expected: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims or whenever courts are acting in their judicial capacity.
actual: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims or whenever courts are acting in their judicial capacity.

expected: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for reasons of substantial public interest, on the basis of Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.
actual: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for reasons of substantial public interest, on the basis of Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.

expected: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for the purposes of preventive or occupational medicine, for the assessment of the working capacity of the employee, medical diagnosis, the provision of health or social care or treatment or the management of health or social care systems and services on the basis of Union or Member State law or pursuant to contract with a health professional and subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in paragraph 3.
actual: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for the purposes of preventive or occupational medicine, for the assessment of the working capacity of the employee, medical diagnosis, the provision of health or social care or treatment or the management of health or social care systems and services on the basis of Union or Member State law or pursuant to contract with a health professional and subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in paragraph 3.

expected: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for reasons of public interest in the area of public health, such as protecting against serious cross-border threats to health or ensuring high standards of quality and safety of health care and of medicinal products or medical devices, on the basis of Union or Member State law which provides for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject, in particular professional secrecy.
actual: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for reasons of public interest in the area of public health, such as protecting against serious cross-border threats to health or ensuring high standards of quality and safety of health care and of medicinal products or medical devices, on the basis of Union or Member State law which provides for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject, in particular professional secrecy.

expected: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) based on Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.
actual: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) based on Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.

expected: Personal data referred to in paragraph 1 may be processed by the processor for the purposes referred to in point (h) of paragraph 2 when those data are processed by or under the responsibility of a professional subject to the obligation of professional secrecy under Union or Member State law or rules established by national competent bodies or by another person also subject to an obligation of secrecy under Union or Member State law or rules established by national competent bodies.
actual: Personal data referred to in paragraph 1 may be processed by the processor for the purposes referred to in point (h) of paragraph 2 when those data are processed by or under the responsibility of a professional subject to the obligation of professional secrecy under Union or Member State law or rules established by national competent bodies or by another person also subject to an obligation of secrecy under Union or Member State law or rules established by national competent bodies.

expected: Processing of personal data by the processor relating to criminal convictions and offences or related security measures based on Article 6(1) shall be carried out only under the control of official authority or when the processing is authorised by Union or Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of data subjects.
actual: Processing by the processor of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences or related security measures based on Article 6(1) shall be carried out only under the control of official authority or when the processing is authorised by Union or Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of data subjects.

expected: Any comprehensive register of criminal convictions shall be kept only under the control of official authority by the controller.
actual: Any comprehensive register of criminal convictions shall be kept only under the control of official authority by the controller.

expected: The information shall be provided by the controller in writing, or by other means, including, where appropriate, by electronic means.
actual: The information shall be provided by the controller in writing, or by other means, including, where appropriate, by electronic means.

expected: When requested by the data subject, the information may be provided orally by the controller, provided that the identity of the data subject is proven by other means.
actual: When requested by the data subject, the information may be provided orally by the controller, provided that the identity of the data subject is proven by other means.

expected: That period may be extended by the controller by two further months where necessary, taking into account the complexity and number of the requests.
actual: That period may be extended by two further months by the controller where necessary, taking into account the complexity and number of the requests.

expected: Where the data subject makes the request by electronic form means, the information shall be provided by the controller by electronic means where possible, unless otherwise requested by the data subject.
actual: Where the data subject makes the request by electronic form means, the information shall be provided by electronic means by the controller where possible, unless otherwise requested by the data subject.

expected: The information to be provided by the controller to data subjects pursuant to Articles 13 and 14 may be provided by the controller in combination with standardised icons in order to give in an easily visible, intelligible and clearly legible manner a meaningful overview of the intended processing.
actual: The information to be provided to data subjects by the controller pursuant to Articles 13 and 14 may be provided by the controller in combination with standardised icons in order to give in an easily visible, intelligible and clearly legible manner a meaningful overview of the intended processing.

expected: Where the icons are presented by the controller electronically they shall be machine-readable.
actual: Where the icons are presented electronically by the controller they shall be machine-readable.

expected: In addition to the information referred to in paragraph 1, the controller shall provide the data subject with the following information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing in respect of the data subject: the period for which the personal data will be stored by the processor, or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period.
actual: In addition to the information referred to in paragraph 1, the controller shall provide the data subject with the following information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing in respect of the data subject: the period for which the personal data will be stored by the processor, or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period.

expected: In addition to the information referred to in paragraph 1, the controller shall provide the data subject with the following information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing in respect of the data subject: where processing by the processor is based on point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right of the data subject to withdraw consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing by the processor based on consent before its withdrawal by the data subject.
actual: In addition to the information referred to in paragraph 1, the controller shall provide the data subject with the following information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing in respect of the data subject by the processor: where processing is based on point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right to withdraw by the data subject consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing by the processor based on consent before its withdrawal by the data subject.

expected: The controller shall provide the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 within a reasonable period after obtaining the personal data, but at the latest within one month, having regard to the specific circumstances in which the personal data are processed by the processor.
actual: The controller shall provide the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 within a reasonable period after obtaining the personal data, but at the latest within one month, having regard to the specific circumstances in which the personal data are processed by the processor.

expected: The controller shall provide the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 if the personal data are to be used by the controller for communication with the data subject, at the latest at the time of the first communication to that data subject.
actual: The controller shall provide the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 if the personal data are to be used for communication with the data subject by the controller, at the latest at the time of the first communication to that data subject.

expected: The controller shall provide the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 if a disclosure to another recipient is envisaged by the controller, at the latest when the personal data are first disclosed by the controller.
actual: The controller shall provide the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 if a disclosure to another recipient is envisaged, at the latest by the controller when the personal data are first disclosed by the controller.

expected: Paragraphs 1 to 4 shall not apply where and insofar as the provision of such information by the controller proves impossible or would involve a disproportionate effort, in particular for processing by the processor for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes, subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in Article 89(1) or in so far as the obligation referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article is likely to render impossible or seriously impair the achievement of the objectives of that processing.
actual: Paragraphs 1 to 4 shall not apply where and insofar as the provision of such information by the controller proves impossible or would involve a disproportionate effort, in particular for processing by the processor for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes, subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in Article 89(1) or in so far as the obligation referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article is likely to render impossible or seriously impair the achievement of the objectives of that processing.

expected: Where personal data are transferred by the processor to a third country or to an international organisation, the data subject shall have the right to be informed by the controller of the appropriate safeguards pursuant to Article 46 relating to the transfer.
actual: Where personal data are transferred to a third country or to an international organisation by the processor, the data subject shall have the right to be informed of the appropriate safeguards by the controller pursuant to Article 46 relating to the transfer.

expected: Where processing by the processor has been restricted under paragraph 1, such personal data shall, with the exception of storage, only be processed by the processor with the data subject’s consent or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims or for the protection of the rights of another natural or legal person or for reasons of important public interest of the Union or of a Member State.
actual: Where processing by the processor has been restricted under paragraph 1, such personal data shall, with the exception of storage, only be processed by the processor with the data subject’s consent or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims or for the protection of the rights of another natural or legal person or for reasons of important public interest of the Union or of a Member State.

expected: Where personal data are processed by the processor for direct marketing purposes, the data subject shall have the right to object at any time to processing by the processor of personal data concerning him or her for such marketing, which includes profiling by the processor to the extent that it is related to such direct marketing.
actual: Where personal data are processed for direct marketing purposes by the processor, the data subject shall have the right to object at any time to processing by the processor of personal data concerning him or her for such marketing, which includes profiling by the processor to the extent that it is related to such direct marketing.

expected: Where the data subject objects to processing by the processor for direct marketing purposes, the personal data shall no longer be processed by the processor for such purposes.
actual: Where the data subject objects to processing by the processor for direct marketing purposes, the personal data shall no longer be processed for such purposes by the processor.

expected: At the latest at the time of the first communication with the data subject, the right referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall be explicitly brought to the attention of the data subject by the controller and shall be presented by the controller clearly and separately from any other information.
actual: At the latest at the time of the first communication with the data subject, the right referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall be explicitly brought to the attention of the data subject by the controller and shall be presented clearly and separately from any other information by the controller.

expected: Where personal data are processed by the processor for scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes pursuant to Article 89(1), the data subject, on grounds relating to his or her particular situation, shall have the right to object to processing of personal data concerning him or her, unless the processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out for reasons of public interest.
actual: Where personal data are processed by the processor for scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes pursuant to Article 89(1), the data subject, on grounds relating to his or her particular situation, shall have the right to object to processing of personal data concerning him or her, unless the processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out for reasons of public interest.

expected: Taking into account the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing by the processor as well as the risks of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure and to be able to demonstrate that processing is performed in accordance with this Regulation.
actual: Taking into account the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing by the processor as well as the risks of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure and to be able to demonstrate that processing is performed in accordance with this Regulation.

expected: Those measures shall be reviewed by the controller and updated by the controller where necessary.
actual: Those measures shall be reviewed by the controller and updated by the controller where necessary.

expected: That obligation applies to the amount of personal data collected by the processor, the extent of their processing by the processor, the period of their storage and their accessibility.
actual: That obligation applies to the amount of personal data collected by the processor, the extent of their processing by the processor, the period of their storage and their accessibility.

expected: In particular, such measures shall ensure that by default personal data are not made accessible by the controller without the individual’s intervention to an indefinite number of natural persons.
actual: In particular, such measures shall ensure that by default personal data are not made by the controller accessible without the individual’s intervention to an indefinite number of natural persons.

expected: The essence of the arrangement shall be made available by the controller to the data subject.
actual: The essence of the arrangement shall be made by the controller available to the data subject.

expected: The representative shall be established by the controller in one of the Member States where the data subjects, whose personal data are processed by the processor in relation to the offering of goods or services to them, or whose behaviour is monitored, are.
actual: The representative shall be established by the controller in one of the Member States where the data subjects, whose personal data are processed by the processor in relation to the offering of goods or services to them, or whose behaviour is monitored, are.

expected: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor processes the personal data only on documented instructions from the controller, including with regard to transfers of personal data by the processor to a third country or an international organisation, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law to which the processor is subject; in such a case, the processor shall inform the controller of that legal requirement before processing, unless that law prohibits such information on important grounds of public interest;.
actual: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor processes the personal data only on documented instructions from the controller, including with regard to transfers by the processor of personal data to a third country or an international organisation, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law to which the processor is subject; in such a case, the processor shall inform the controller of that legal requirement before processing, unless that law prohibits such information on important grounds of public interest;.

expected: Adherence of a processor to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used by the controller as an element by which to demonstrate sufficient guarantees as referred to in paragraphs 1 and 4 of this Article.
actual: Adherence of a processor to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used by the controller as an element by which to demonstrate sufficient guarantees as referred to in paragraphs 1 and 4 of this Article.

expected: In the controller assessing the appropriate level of security account shall be taken by the controller in particular of the risks that are presented by processing by the processor, in particular from accidental or unlawful destruction by the processor, loss by the processor, alteration by the processor, unauthorised disclosure by the processor of, or access to personal data transmitted by the processor, stored by the processor or otherwise processed by the processor.
actual: In assessing by the controller the appropriate level of security account shall be taken by the controller in particular of the risks that are presented by processing by the processor, in particular from accidental or unlawful destruction by the processor, loss by the processor, alteration by the processor, unauthorised disclosure of by the processor, or access to personal data transmitted by the processor, stored by the processor or otherwise processed by the processor.

expected: Adherence to an approved code of conduct by the controller and the processor as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used as an element by which to demonstrate compliance with the requirements set out in paragraph 1 of this Article.
actual: Adherence to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used by the controller as an element by which to demonstrate compliance with the requirements set out in paragraph 1 of this Article.

expected: Where the notification to the supervisory authority is not made by the controller within 72 hours, it shall be accompanied by reasons for the delay.
actual: Where the notification to the supervisory authority is not made within 72 hours by the controller, it shall be accompanied by reasons for the delay.

expected: The notification by the the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the nature of the personal data breach including where possible, the categories and approximate number of data subjects concerned and the categories and approximate number of personal data records concerned.
actual: The notification by the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the nature of the personal data breach including where possible, the categories and approximate number of data subjects concerned and the categories and approximate number of personal data records concerned.

expected: The notification by the the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least communicate the name and contact details of the data protection officer or other contact point where more information can be obtained by the controller.
actual: The notification by the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least communicate the name and contact details of the data protection officer or other contact point where more information can be obtained by the controller.

expected: The notification by the the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the likely consequences of the personal data breach.
actual: The notification by the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the likely consequences of the personal data breach.

expected: The notification by the the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the controller to address the personal data breach, including, where appropriate, measures to mitigate its possible adverse effects.
actual: The notification by the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the controller to address the personal data breach, including, where appropriate, measures to mitigate its possible adverse effects.

expected: Where, and in so far as, it is not possible for the controller to provide the information at the same time, the information may be provided by the controller in phases without undue further delay.
actual: Where, and in so far as, it is not possible to provide the information at the same time by the controller, the information may be provided in phases without undue further delay by the controller.
